net.hudup

Class Balancer

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.hudup.Balancer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AccessPoint

    public class Balancer
extends java.lang.Object
implements AccessPoint
    There are 5 applications of Hudup framework such as Evaluator, Server, Listener, Balancer, Toolkit.
    • Evaluator makes evaluation on recommendation algorithms.
    • Server runs as a recommendation server that serves incoming user request for producing a list of recommended items or allowing users to access database.
    • Listener is responsible for receiving requests from users and dispatching such request to Server.
    • Balancer is a special Listener that supports balancing.
    • Toolkit is a utility application that assists users to set up and modify Hudup database.
    These applications must implement the interface AccessPoint which is used to start modules of Hudup framework. Although this class is called balancer, it starts the real balancer specified by Balancer. Recall that listener receives incoming requests and dispatch such requests to server. Listener which has load balancing function is called balancer. Project homepage: http://www.locnguyen.net/st/products/hudup
    Version:
    10.0
    Author:
    Loc Nguyen
